title: Caroline Flack strips off and sips champagne on Instagram
text:
Caroline Flack knows exactly how to get your attention on Instagram (Picture: Getty/Instagram)

Caroline Flack knows exactly how to catch the eye on Instagram.

The Love Island host has been busy bossing another working project in Manchester lately and after successfully wrapping things up, she decided to throw a party to celebrate. Naturally.

But a wrap party wouldn’t be a wrap party without a celebratory snap or two and Caroline had just the pose in mind to grab the attention of her Instagram followers.

What’s that you ask? Oh y’know just stripping off until you have nothing on and sipping champagne from the glass.

Caroline looked seriously fierce as she posed completely in her birthday suit while clutching onto a bottle of pink Laurent Perrier champagne, like the boss lady she is.

Caroline casually stripped off and sipped champagne (Picture: Instagram)

Acting natural, of course, Caroline sipped from her glass and captioned her cheekily revealing snap: ‘Quite A week… we’re having a little wrap party.’

Advertisement

Some party, eh.

Caroline, who is dating new boyfriend Lewis Burton, didn’t go into detail when it came to the secret project she has been working on, so fans may have to wait a little longer for that one to be uncovered.

But, until then, we can all get excited over Flack coming back to our screens early next year for the very first winter version of Love Island.

Our fave show is getting a do-over in South Africa for the winter season and Caroline has teased it’s set to be the ‘hottest series of Love Island yet’.

She told The Sun: ‘I literally cannot wait, it is going to be so hot, probably the hottest one yet. Cape Town, can you believe it? Love Island’s twice a year now, it’s going to be mad.’

Caroline is gearing up to present the new series of winter Love Island (Picture: Instagram)

Bosses at ITV2 decided to launch a winter version of Love Island, due to its ever-growing popularity.

Two series a year means host Caroline is going to find her schedule super packed, but we’re guessing she’s OK with that, as she’s previously said how she always puts her career first in life.

Speaking on Kathy Burke’s Channel 4 show, All Woman, earlier this year, Caroline said that being so career-driven can make her feel a little ‘selfish’.

She said: ‘I’ve still kind of always put work first – wake up in the morning, go to work, come home… I’m scared it’s going to get too late where I’ve wanted to go, “Right, maybe slow down, think about having kids and maybe think about settling down.”‘

‘But I’ve never had that. I feel guilty for it sometimes,’ she confessed. ‘I feel like maybe I’m being selfish.’
